Shift4 Tasking - Confidential

•	Shift4 Payments Confidential Internal Tasking and Timeline for Key Initiatives
•	Last Updated: June 7, 2018

Merchant Boarding Application / Underwriting
-Task Owners: Nate & Mike (Product) & Dan (Engineering)
-Overall Status: IN PROGRESS
-Overall Target Completion: Q1-2019

Summary: S4 has a very strong and proprietary POS marketplace, but the merchant boarding/underwriting/risk
process has not been a core cornpetericy of S4 and a major area of focus/investrnent.. In order to support continued
growth. add hundreds of thousands of new merchants, compete with the likes of First Data/Square/etc., enable fast
provisioning of accounts, build a proper product strategy, and meet network/compliance rules, we must invest heavily
in this area and build a state-of-the-art platform that will take us to the next level.

Key Actions/Milestones:

•	 Complete integration of recently acquired 3rd party risk scoring and fraud detection tool (completed)
•	 Partner with 3rd party and automate process for KYC and other compliance requirements (November 2018)
•	 Integrate, [redacted] (September 2018)
•	 Allow auto-approvals, auto-declines, and build a sophisticated risk matrix (December 2018)
•	 Build a brand new, intuitive, and responsive user experience for our internal underwrifing d e p a r t m e n t .[redacted]
•	 Develop a modern merchant boarding application for both our sales partners and merchants to leverage in order
    to supply and collect all of the necessary boarding documents and data elements upfront (Q1-2019}
•	 Build a module to perform pre-screen checks on principals/owners/guarantors so we have more data upfront
    during the evaluation process (July 2018}
•	 Automatically generate all necessary application, risk. and processing documents (October 2018}
•	 Develop "e-signature" or "click-signature" capabilities within the new merchant application module so we
    can avoid having to use physical copies with wet-signatures (Q1-2019)
•	 Create an API for the new application module and all documents for our sales partners to build their own front-
    end and completely contro/own l the entire merchant experience {Q4-2018 for limited Alpha)
•	 Roll out the platform to our sales partners in a strategic and staged approach (staggered beta rollout starts 2019)
•	 Consolidate all of our merchant onboarding process across all divisions and products (Q2 2019)
o We currently have a different boarding process for POS merchants, gateway merchants, merchants using
   our e-commerce platform ("Lighthouse Links"), lodging merchants. etc,

Shift4 Tasking - Confidential
New Merchant Portal
- Task Owners: Nate & Mike (Product) & Dan (Engineering)
- Overall Status: IN PROGRESS
- Overall Target Completion: Q1-2019

Summary: Today, S4 does not have a centralized merchant portal. Merchants that use S4 for POS software do
have access to a reporting tool and merchants that leverage S4's payments-as-a-service utilize our Lighthouse
platform, but what we do not have is one single portal that ALL S4 merchants can use, regardfess of where they
boarded, what software they use, or their industry. We should be able to present key information (recent.
transactions, chargeback data. statements, etc.) and the ability to self-service (order supplies, contact support, etc.)
across all merchants, S4 products. and divisions.

Key Actions/Milestones;

•	 Research and select a top-tier 3,d  party platform that would provide the core framework for us to build on top
    of so we don't need to build this completely from scratch (Q1-2019)
•	 Evaluate existing S4 systems and consolidate into one merchant-facing brand/platform (02-2019)
•	 Build new features/functions into this platform to cater to new verticals and specific industry types (02-2019)
•	 Completely white-label the selected 3rd party platform and implement into [redacted] (02-2019)
•	 Build a new, modern user interface for both desktop and mobile (02-2019)

New Partner Portal

- Task Owners: Nate & Mike (Product) & Dan (Engineering)
- Overall Status: IN PROGRESS
- Overall Target Completion: Q1-2019

Summary: Similar to the lack of modem merchant portal, we do not have a state-of the-art platform for our
vast network of sales partners, resellers, and referral partners. The lack of automation. inability to quickly make
changes/updates, and absence of modem user interface makes it very difficult for us to not only attract and keep
productive sales partners: but also support them effectively based on our internal resource constraints,

Key Actions/Milestones:

•	 Research and select a top-tier 3rd party platform that would provide the core framework for us to build on top
    of so we don't need to build this completely from scratch (July 2018)
•	 Convert all sales portals and tools across all products into one interface with consolidated access/login (ongoing)
•	 Integrate the new merchant application module into the partner portal (01-2019)
•	 White-label the selected 3rd party platform and add all of our necessary toois/features (ongoing)
•	 Build a modern user interface for both desktop and mobile (ongoing)
•	 Create API's for all major areas of functionality (ongoing)
•	 Build out our residual platform to have more complete statements/reporting, the ability to pay higher upfront.
    bonuses, and offer more transparency (03-2019)

FIRST AMENDMENT TO THE AMENDED AND RESTATED
REFERRAL PARTNER AGREEMENT

This First Amendment to the Amended and Restated Referral Partner Agreement (this
“Amendment") is entered into as of this 10 day of October, 2018 (the “Effective Date”),
by and between CardConnect, LLC, a Delaware limited liability company ("CardConnect").
having an office at 1000 Continental Drive, Suite 300, King of Prussia, Pennsylvania 19406.
and Shift4 Payments, LLC, a Delaware Limited liability company ("Referral Partner"). having
an office at 2202 West Lone Cactus Drive, Suite 100. Phocnix, Arizona 85027.

WITNESSETH

WHEREAS, CardConnect and Referral Partner are parties to that certain Amended and
Restated Referral Partner Agreement dated as of April 5, 2017 and as amended and restated
as of March 12, 2018 (the "Agreement"); and

WHEREAS, CardConnect and Referral Partner desire to amend the Agreement to reflect
certain changes to the Referral Program.

NOW, THEREFORE, for good and valuable consideration, the receipt and sufficiency
of which is hereby acknowledged, CardConnect and Referral Partner hereby agree as follows:

Section 1. Definitions. All capitalized terms not otherwise defined herein shall have the meaning
ascribed to such terms in the Agreement.

Section 2. Amendments.
    a. Section I .I(v) is hereby amended to include the following language: ", including the
    provision of EMV terminals."
    b. Schedule A. Section 3(a)(i) is hereby deleted an replaced with the following:
        "Referral Partner will implement, deploy, and maintain software that will utilize
        CardConnect's tokenization method ("P2PE") for Card present transactions and will
        integrate to the CardConnect Gateway for eCommerce transactions."
    c. Schedule A. Section 3(a)(iv) is hereby deleted and replaced with the following:
        "Following Distribution Date, Referral Partner will market and use commercially
        reasonable efforts to distribute CardConnect Products to Referral Partner Merchants:
        provided that the obligations of Referral Partner pursuant to this Section 3(aXiv) shall
        be subject to the maximum number of Merchants and the considerations to be paid to
        CardConnect set forth on the attached Schedule C (the "Tasking"), which Tasking shall
        be updated from time to time upon mutual agreement of Referral Partner and
        CardConnect, with such mutuality being evidenced by a signed writing from each such
        party."

Section 3. General.
    a. This Amendment contains the entire agreement between CardConnect and Referral
    Partner relating to the subject matter hereof and supersedes all prior or contemporaneous.
    oral or written, communications, proposals, representations, and warranties, and prevails
    over any conflicting or additional terms of any quote. order acknowledgment.
    b. Except as otherwise specifically amended hereby, all the terms of the Agreement shall
    remain in full force and effect. To the extent the terms of the Agreement conflict with the
    terms of this Amendment, the terms of this Amendment shall prevail.
    c. This Amendment shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of the
    State of New York. without resort to its principles of conflicts of laws. Each of the parties
    hereto irrevocably and unconditionally consents to submit to the exclusive jurisdiction of
    the courts of the State of New York and of the United States of America, in each case
    located in New York County, for any action. suit or proceeding arising out of or relating to
    this Amendment.
    d. This Amendment may be executed in any number of counterparts. all of which taken
    together shall contribute one and the same instrument. Signatures delivered
    electronically shall be binding for all purposes hereof.

IN WITNESS WHEREOF. CardConnect and Referral Partner have caused this Amendment
to be executed by their duly authorized representatives as of the Effective Date set forth above

•	Shift4 Payments Confidential Internal Tasking and Timeline for Key Initiatives
•	Last Updated: June 7, 2018

Merchant Boarding Application / Underwriting
-Task Owners: Nate & Mike (Product) & Dan (Engineering)
-Overall Status: IN PROGRESS
-Overall Target Completion: Q1-2019

Summary: S4 has a very strong and proprietary POS marketplace, but the merchant boarding/underwriting/risk
process has not been a core cornpetericy of S4 and a major area of focus/investrnent.. In order to support continued
growth. add hundreds of thousands of new merchants, compete with the likes of First Data/Square/etc., enable fast
provisioning of accounts, build a proper product strategy, and meet network/compliance rules, we must invest heavily
in this area and build a state-of-the-art platform that will take us to the next level.

Key Actions/Milestones:

•	 Complete integration of recently acquired 3rd party risk scoring and fraud detection tool (completed)
•	 Partner with 3rd party and automate process for KYC and other compliance requirements (November 2018)
•	 Integrate, [redacted] (September 2018)
•	 Allow auto-approvals, auto-declines, and build a sophisticated risk matrix (December 2018)
•	 Build a brand new, intuitive, and responsive user experience for our internal underwrifing d e p a r t m e n t .[redacted]
•	 Develop a modern merchant boarding application for both our sales partners and merchants to leverage in order
    to supply and collect all of the necessary boarding documents and data elements upfront (Q1-2019}
•	 Build a module to perform pre-screen checks on principals/owners/guarantors so we have more data upfront
    during the evaluation process (July 2018}
•	 Automatically generate all necessary application, risk. and processing documents (October 2018}
•	 Develop "e-signature" or "click-signature" capabilities within the new merchant application module so we
    can avoid having to use physical copies with wet-signatures (Q1-2019)
•	 Create an API for the new application module and all documents for our sales partners to build their own front-
    end and completely contro/own l the entire merchant experience {Q4-2018 for limited Alpha)
•	 Roll out the platform to our sales partners in a strategic and staged approach (staggered beta rollout starts 2019)
•	 Consolidate all of our merchant onboarding process across all divisions and products (Q2 2019)
o We currently have a different boarding process for POS merchants, gateway merchants, merchants using
   our e-commerce platform ("Lighthouse Links"), lodging merchants. etc,

Shift4 Tasking - Confidential
New Merchant Portal
- Task Owners: Nate & Mike (Product) & Dan (Engineering)
- Overall Status: IN PROGRESS
- Overall Target Completion: Q1-2019

Summary: Today, S4 does not have a centralized merchant portal. Merchants that use S4 for POS software do
have access to a reporting tool and merchants that leverage S4's payments-as-a-service utilize our Lighthouse
platform, but what we do not have is one single portal that ALL S4 merchants can use, regardfess of where they
boarded, what software they use, or their industry. We should be able to present key information (recent.
transactions, chargeback data. statements, etc.) and the ability to self-service (order supplies, contact support, etc.)
across all merchants, S4 products. and divisions.

Key Actions/Milestones;

•	 Research and select a top-tier 3,d  party platform that would provide the core framework for us to build on top
    of so we don't need to build this completely from scratch (Q1-2019)
•	 Evaluate existing S4 systems and consolidate into one merchant-facing brand/platform (02-2019)
•	 Build new features/functions into this platform to cater to new verticals and specific industry types (02-2019)
•	 Completely white-label the selected 3rd party platform and implement into [redacted] (02-2019)
•	 Build a new, modern user interface for both desktop and mobile (02-2019)

New Partner Portal

- Task Owners: Nate & Mike (Product) & Dan (Engineering)
- Overall Status: IN PROGRESS
- Overall Target Completion: Q1-2019

Summary: Similar to the lack of modem merchant portal, we do not have a state-of the-art platform for our
vast network of sales partners, resellers, and referral partners. The lack of automation. inability to quickly make
changes/updates, and absence of modem user interface makes it very difficult for us to not only attract and keep
productive sales partners: but also support them effectively based on our internal resource constraints,

Key Actions/Milestones:

•	 Research and select a top-tier 3rd party platform that would provide the core framework for us to build on top
    of so we don't need to build this completely from scratch (July 2018)
•	 Convert all sales portals and tools across all products into one interface with consolidated access/login (ongoing)
•	 Integrate the new merchant application module into the partner portal (01-2019)
•	 White-label the selected 3rd party platform and add all of our necessary toois/features (ongoing)
•	 Build a modern user interface for both desktop and mobile (ongoing)
•	 Create API's for all major areas of functionality (ongoing)
•	 Build out our residual platform to have more complete statements/reporting, the ability to pay higher upfront.
    bonuses, and offer more transparency (03-2019)
